Are you sure you want to cancel the task?

"About this activity
This activity measures your gait and balance as you walk and stand still. Do not continue if you cannot safely walk unassisted.
Why this activity
The way you walk and stand will give us clues about how your body is changing during pregnancy.
Please remember that the gait task is only for the purpose of research. We will analyze the data after the study is over. If you need medical care, please talk to your physician."
This activity measures your gait and balance as you walk and stand still. Do not continue if you cannot safely walk unassisted.
Find a place where you can safely walk unassisted for about 20 steps in a straight line.\nPut your device in a pocket or bag and follow the audio instructions.
Walk up to %1$d steps in a straight line.
Turn around, and walk back to where you started.
Your data will be analyzed and you will be notified when your results are ready.

"About this activity
Every other week, we’ll ask you to complete this task in which you’ll walk continuously at a regular walking pace for six minutes.
Why this activity
This activity will help us understand how your body reacts to and recovers from activity."
This activity monitors your heart rate and measures how far you can walk in %1$s.
Walk outdoors at your fastest possible pace for %1$s. When you’re done, sit (or stand) and rest comfortably for %2$s. To begin, tap Get Started.
Walk as fast as you can for %1$s.
Your data will be analyzed and you will be notified when your results are ready.

"About this activity
Twice each day, we’ll ask you to complete this task in which you’ll be asked to recall a series of numbers.
Why this activity
This activity will help us understand your attention and memory and how they change throughout your pregnancy."
Quickly shake the device when the circle appears
